channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Broken glass and rubbish on the street, 10th August
item.description:
Every Saturday and Sunday morning there is an amount of broken glass and littering on Rivington Street due to the bars allowing customers to leave the premises with their drinks. It is worse since they are now allowed to put table on the street from 6pm

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rivington Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant drop of construction and random rubbish, 10th August
item.description:
This area is constantly being used to drop large amount of items and sometimes left for days. It smells and attracts rodents making the street look messy.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rivington Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light too bright and creating strange ground effect, 10th August
item.description:
This street light was recently replaced. It has since been far brighter than other lights in the area, and is also creating a strange pattern on the ground immediately below it. A shield was also previously in place to prevent the bright light shining into the house next to it. This shield has not been reinstalled following the light replacement, and so the light is now also very intrusive into the living room and bedroom of the house. Please (1) lower the brightness, (2) fix the strange pattern created by the light, and (3) reinstall the shield. This problem was previously reported under reference 158264. It was logged as fixed, but this is not the case. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Charlwood Street, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The Glass needs a good clean in the timetable display, 10th August
item.description:
The Glass on the timetable display which is mounted on the actual bus stop is extremely dirty on the outside and has not been clean for years. It is almost impossible to read the time tables which are also slipping down behind the glass.

item.title: Tree needs attention, 10th August
item.description:
I am writing to formally request that the council attend to a tree located on the corner of 1 Sandway Road and 8 Elmstone Terrace which is causing both damage and potential safety risks. The roots of this tree are growing underneath our driveway and path or and have caused significant unevenness and cracking. This creates a trip hazard and may lead to further structural damage if not addressed promptly. Additionally, the branches of the tree are overhanging our property and regularly drop debris, including larger branches. This is a particular concern as we park our motorhome directly below, and falling branches could cause substantial damage to our vehicle. I would appreciate it if the council could arrange for an inspection of the tree and take appropriate maintenance action, such as root management and pruning, to reduce both the risk of property damage and any potential injury. Please let me know when an inspection can be scheduled. I am happy to provide photographs to illustrate the issues described. Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Okemore Gardens, St Mary Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
